subject: Re: [junit] Where am I going wrong?
msgSnippet: ... [both variables are Strings] ... Strings are immutable, so I don t see that this can happen. What am I missing? [Amusingly, the only Google hit I got for
messageBody:
On Friday 02 April 2004 23:09, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> mcgqa wrote:

> > */
> > public void testRegisterUser() {
> > dupLoginId = newLoginId;

[both variables are Strings]

> This line is probably wrong. I assume you want dupLoginId to be a
> "snapshot" of newLoginId. Right now, they refer to the same physical
> string, so a change through one reference will be seen through the
> second reference.

Strings are immutable, so I don't see that this can happen. What am I missing?

[Amusingly, the only Google hit I got for the quoted string "java alias problem"
was your message, and without the quotes it looks like a bit of a jumble.]

> Try dupLoginId = new String(newLoginId), a rare instance where you
> actually /want/ to copy a string.

About the only use of that that I can think of is to force the String to be
a copy, not a slice, but off-hand I don't know if even that is guaranteed ...

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
